title: Air travel
answer:
Supporting ideas:
Agree:
1. Aircrafts burn finite fossil fuels, and emit greenhouse gases in the atmosphere at high altitude, making them particularly harmful to the climate.
2. It is a risky program with lots of uncertainties.

Disagree:
1. Air travel allows you to relax more than driving because you don't have to constantly stay alert to avoid an accident.
2. Flying shortens the travel time to your destination. A longer trip, such as traveling across the country, shrinks from multiple days in the car to just one day of travel on a plane.
question: Some people think air travel has more negative impact than positive on modern life. What do you think?
kword: Air, travel, traveling,travelling, negative, positive, space, modern, life, society, environment, financial, economic

title: Age restrictions
answer:
Supporting ideas:
1.For young drivers, one of the greatest dangers facing them on the road is their lack of experience and immaturity. 
2.They could be faced with challenging or dangerous situations on a daily basis that they may not know how to respond to safely.
3.The fatal crash rate per mile driven is nearly twice as high for 16-17 year-olds as it is for 18-19 year-olds.
4.It shouldn't be an age at all. There are plenty of 14 year-olds with the maturity and knowledge level to vote, while there are plenty of 40 year-olds without it.
5.Youths with immaturity are not mentally prepared to vote, so if they are allowed to vote, they cannot make a comprehensive decision.
question: Age restrictions can be seen everywhere. It is believed that people should not do things until they reach the right age, such as marriage, and driving. Select one activity and state the minimum age that you think. Support with your own experiences.
kword: Age, restriction,restrictions, right, marrige,married, driving, car,cars, family,families, safe, safety, minimum

title: Foreign language learning（AI）
answer:
Supporting ideas:
1.Although machines can do the word to word translation, they cannot weigh every word according to different situations. Therefore, some contexts are translated awkward.
2.When we are under the communication, especial in the face-to-face communication, we can understand people judging from their expression, body gestures and so on, even if we do not use any words, while translation machine cannot do this 
3.English study offers people a new and different perspective of English-speaking countries because language and culture are closely related to each other.That means, we not only learn the language but also know more about the culture, history and customs.
4.People in different job markets tend to communicate with each other all around the world. So when do a face-to-face communication, it is impossible to use machine to do the translation. And also, it shows unprofessional.
question: Advanced technology such as artificial intelligence can translate a foreign language easily. Do you think learning a foreign language is still necessary? Support your point of view with your own experience?
kword: Advanced, technology,technologies, artificial, intelligence, foreign, language, neccessary, neccessity

A certain amount of competition can motivate us and make us work hard towards the goal in our heart.

Disadvantages

Being over-competitive leads to physical and mental strain.Competition causes confrontation and conflict between people.

title: Should there be a maximum wage for high pay people? Is it good or bad?
answer:
Supporting ideas:
1.Economists love to talk about incentives. If we limit the maximum wage for these people, such as business men, they lack the motivation to make more profit for their companies.
2.It may seem reasonable to allow people to earn as much as companies are willing to pay, because these people deserve to earn such a high-pay salary.
3. If companies offer excellent pay packages, they can attract the most talented people in their fields to work for them, especially for many world-renowned technology companies, such as Google and Apple.
4. On the other hand, if governments restricted the ceiling of the salary, the gap between the wealthy and the poor will be reduced. Therefore, poverty and crime rates may fall because the general population will experience an improved standard of living.
question: Should there be a maximum wage of high-pay group? Is it good or bad?

title: Shorten working week
answer:
Supporting ideas: 
Adavantages:
Laying off workers rather than working fewer hours would push more families into financial trouble.If workers or employees reduce their working hours, they can keep their jobs and get paid during economic crises.
The application of high-tech knowledge and skills in enterprises is becoming more and more common, so the demand for manpower is gradually decreasing.
Reducing working hours will make employees more efficient in work.Lesshoursatjobs would increase the balance between work and family.

Disadvantages:
It's unfair that the more talented people get reduced payment because they have to ensure other workers have a source of income.
A large number of employees with limited working hours will increase the management cost for companies.

Applicable for adults: This is applicable to the adults as well, so they could have more leisure time to be with their family while being employed.
Unapplicable for adults: Adults usually have a much higher financial burden than younger employees do, because they have family to raise, and the shorter working hours will cut their incomes.

kword: unemployment, problem,problems, shorter,shorten, working, laying off, employer,employers

title: Foreign language learning
answer:
Supporting ideas:
Agree:
1 Learning a foreign language is helpful for the development of children's brain, since learning any language other than their mother tongue, activates various parts of the brain, and they can think in a different way to explain their opinions. 
2 Language is an important aspect for people to communicate with others around the world. Knowing at least one foreign language is the trend for people. Therefore, if children can learn the new language at the early age, they can become more competitive in future.

Disagree:
1.Children are not capable to understand complex structure and grammar of new language. Moreover, in this age, they are more keen to learn and practice their native language. In addition, kids also may confuse the pronunciation of words between different languages.
2.If we force children to learn new language against their wish then it may possible that they feel pressure of language learning. It may also possible that children even lose interest to learn own native language.
question: Learning a new language at an early age is helpful for children. Is it more positive for their future aspect or have some adverse effects. Agree or disagree?

title: Deduction of late submission
answer:
Supporting ideas
Agree: 
1. The deduction of the score may serve as a reminder to students with procrastination, helping them realize the importance of time management and improve their efficiency.
2. No punishment on these students may discourage students who submit their assignments on time, making them lose enthusiasm and copying to procrastinate next time, thus the whole learning environment will be getting worse.

Disagree: 
1. Since each student has a preferred and distinct way of learning, the deadline may cause students who work hard but slowly to feel anxious and thus slow down their paces to accomplish the task in turn.
2. Students may fail to complete the task on time due to some uncontrollable factors, and these students can be given some flexibility in submitting their task, or a negative impact would be exerted on them that they may be less motivated in the future.

Recommendation：
1. Students need to manage their time more effectively and bring out the ultimate of their potential to allocate time reasonably.
2. If students find it difficult to accomplish the assignment on time, they may seek advice and guidance from teachers.
question: Some universities deduct marks from students' work if given in late,what are your views and what action will you recommend to take?

title: Salaries
answer:
Supporting ideas
Agree: 
The average salary of professional athletes is much higher than that of the individuals doing normal works, because the athletes are more likely to be faced with dangers, especially health risks. 
For example, professional gymnasts will have a higher risk of fracture when they are taking daily exercises. 
As a result, the higher salary can be regarded as the compensation of doing such dangerous activities. 
Moreover, some professional athletes are trained to win the glory for their countries so that they are eligible to get the corresponding rewards. 
For instance, the gold medalists in the Olympic Games bring honors to their nations, strengthening the global image of their nations. Thus, it is understandable that they should be paid more.

Disagree:
There are also certain types of work full of dangers, including construction workers and electricians. 
The working conditions of these jobs might be difficult and tough while the salaries of these workers are, to a large extent, less than that of the professional athletes, which might be seen as unfair for a lot of people.
question: People of professional sports can earn very high salaries. Some people say that it is unfair and other professions deserving higher salaries. To what extent do you agree of this opinion?

1.With the development of the internet, the younger employees are easily to be delivered more knowledge or practical skills, accumulating multiple abilities which could be readily used in the labor market.

title: Governments vs Economic growth (新题)
answer:
Supporting ideas
Validity (有效性，正确性) & Implication:
1. The continuous economic growth, to a large extent, is the prerequisite of a country’s sustainable development. If the governments cannot promise the sustained economic growth, citizens are more likely to suffer from financial crisis. 
As a result, the prospect of the country might be compromised.
2. The public welfare is based on the economic situation of a country, which means that every government should seek for an effective and efficient way to maintain the economic growth so as to provide its citizens with high level of living standard, including the medical and educational support.
3. While some people believe that it is impossible for governments to maintain the continuous economic growth because the economic cycle is something we cannot change. According to Adam Smith, the macroeconomic cycle often involves four phases, including recession, depression, recovery and prosperity, which means that the continued economic growth is hardly to achieve in theory.
question: Governments promise continuous economic growth,but it is actually an illusion. Some people think that governments should abandon this. Please talk about the validity and implications.

title: National happiness index (新题)
answer:
Supporting ideas
Agree:
1.People’s happiness is of crucial importance for maintaining solidarity and stability in a country.
2.National happiness is more revealing than economic increase because it reflects different aspects of the society, including house price, traffic system, natural environment and so forth. 
3. Economic growth does not necessarily mean we could have a happier life, because many workers have to work overtime, which leads to a stressful lifestyle.

Disagree:
 1. A strong economy creates jobs, provides opportunities for the government to invest in greater infrastructure and leads to a more advanced country

For some students, finding a job after graduation enables them to be financially independent and even release the financial burden of the family; 4. Establish social network Continuing education proves to be more essential: 1. Continuing education can strengthen students’ professional skills so that they are more likely to get promoted in their future positions; 2. Pursuing higher education after graduation seems to be more significant because it brings a greater career prospect.

title: The popularity of English (高频)
answer:
Supporting ideas
Advantage: 
1.  More convenient: With the popularity of English, the increasing number of literature and documents were translated into English. People could be delivered more knowledge or news in English via smartphones, which is reported from other countries.
2.  Master another language: People who are bilingual would be able to master another language. They are not only proficient with other languages but they have also nurtured valuable learning skills, ultimately possessing comparative advantage in employment. 

Disadvantage: 
Minor language endangerment: People, who speak minor languages, are more likely to speak English. In this way, some minor languages are highly endangered.
question: Nowadays,English has been widely used all over the world. Why？What are the advantages and disadvantages of this phenomenon?

title: Medical technology
answer:
Supporting ideas
Blessing: 
1. Medical technology has increased people's life expectancy to a large extent, and vaccines has helped a large number of people to fight against diseases.
2. Moreover, some patients could get better within a shorter period of time by using the advanced medical technology.
3. Some people who get the malaria can be completely cured by taking medicine or injecting vaccines, which reduces the rate of mortality and increases the life expectancy.
4. Medical technology could prevent people from catching certain illnesses by improving the immune system.

Cursing: 
1. With the help of modern medical technology, people's life expectancy can be extended. However, some people have pointed out the negative aspects of this phenomenon.
2. For those people who are suffering from severe diseases, their families may be faced with a heavy financial burden because it is hard for them to pay the expensive medical fee. For example, some patients need to be treated with chemotherapy, which costs a lot. As a result, their families may have to sell houses or borrow money from others in order to extend the life of the patients. In this case, the medical technology can be seen as a curse for people.
question: Medical technology is responsive for the increasing average life expectancy. Do you think it is a curse or a blessing?

title: Music affects children’s learning  (高频)
answer: Supporting ideasAgree: 1.	Music, especially classical music, can activate various parts of the brain and enhance their brain development. For example, those children who listen to music more frequently tend to have better academic results at schools. 2.	Moreover, music can help young people to study in a more effective and efficient way by improving their concentration ability. 3.	children who find it difficult to memorize numbers, alphabets, animal names or other things can be made to learn those with the help of music. Teachers can make musical tunes and make the lessons interesting for the students. Moreover, when students learn the things in such fun way, it remains in their mind for a more extended period 4.	Finally, when children are introduced to music as a subject in young age, they develop a more positive attitude towards life and enjoy their learning phase. This optimistic view of theirs helps them in becoming more calm and relaxed individuals in the later stages of their life. Later on, when they have to face the competitiveness of life, they stay peaceful with the help of music. Disagree: Children who love music may have poor performance on their major courses, such as math and literature. For instance, some children spend a large amount of time on listening to music so that they have less time to practice critical thinking by attending discussion sessions. As a result, their learning ability are more likely to be impaired.
question: Certain type of music affects young children’s learning. Researchers have researched on it. Some people agree and some disagree. What is your opinion? / Some people say music promotes children learning. However,there are mixed results on impact of music generated from researches. To what extent do you agree or disagree that: music has impacts on humans' life?

title: The Ageing Population
postContent:
In some countries, the birth rate is slowing, xxx problem of an ageing population, what is the causes and effects of this issue? How to solve this problem?

Supporting ideas

Population Ageing is a very significant phenomenon in the 21st century. It describes the effects that occur when the average age of a country increases. There are two main causesof population ageing: increasing life expectancy and declining birth rates. Currently, the vast majority of countries have an aging population and this trend is expected to accelerate for the remainder of this century.

Life expectancy is increasing around the world thanks to advances in science and technology which are improving our quality of life. The most impactful developments are in the areas of nutrition and medical science. As a race, humans are healthier than ever before and we have the means of treating many diseases and injuries that would have been fatal in the past. Reduced fertility rates are the result of many different factors such as economic pressures, gender equality and the availability of contraception.

An ageing population poses a large economic challenge for most countries. Current predictions show that by the end of the century, the earth's population will be in decline. The result of this trend is that each country will be burdened with a large number of senior citizens who are unable to effectively contribute to their national economy. Many countries will be unable to afford the pensions that need to be paid, nor the additional cost and pressures added to existing welfare systems.

There have been a number of solutions which have been implemented in an attempt to address the issue: Australia has implemented the use of superannuation funds to reducepeople's dependence on pensions after retirement. Furthermore, the age of retirement has also been pushed back to compensate for the longer lifespans. This solution may not be very effective due to the fact that elderly people work less productively. In some countries, governments have also been introducing more "family friendly" laws and policies to encourage women to have more children.

title: Xnophobia
postContent: Xnophobia has accelerated rapidly in the western countries. According to you what solutions can be proposed by government and individuals?

title: Animal Rights
postContent:
Animal Rights

Supporting ideas

In recent years, humanity has begun to question the anthropocentric beliefs and structure of our society. Previously, it was widely believed that human needs and desires outweighed the rights of other living organisms such as animals and nature. It is now evident that this kind of thinking has led to extremely reckless behavior with very little accountability. Animals rights in particular have gained widespread support in Australia and other western countries. If animals have equal rights to humans, then are we entitled to use them for our own benefit? This puts the question to many issues such as inhumane farming practices, animal experimentation and animal abuse.

There are many farming practices that are now condemned by the general public. Animal rights organisations such as the RSPCA have been campaigning for farming regulations thatminimizes the amount of pain that livestock suffer. They have also been seeking amendments to hunting policies and the establishment of more natural heritage sites. These can be considered practical approaches to protect animal rights which makes concessions towards the realities of the situation. More extreme approaches which have been suggested include the complete cessation of all farming activities and for everyone to convert to vegetarianism.

Currently, it can be argued that using animals is still very necessary to sustain our lives. Although some practices such as animal experimentation may have horrific consequences on the animals involved, they are generally tolerated because they have the potential to save countless human lives. Other practices such as the consumption of meat are too deeply ingrained in our culture for us to realistically end them. Although most people support animal welfare, the decision to become a vegetarian and to boycott animal products is still considered an individual life choice rather than a social expectation.

title: Economic Globalisation
postContent:
Economic globalisation

Supporting ideas

Globalisation describes the process of the whole world becoming more and more interconnected. There are three main forms of globalisation; economic, cultural and political. Globalisation did not become a big topic of interest until quite recently (The 1970's). The evolution of transport and communications technologies; alongside business and trade relationships have made the nations of the world much closer and more dependent on each other. Part 1 of this series will focus on the economic side of this phenomenon.

Economic globalisation is generally seen as a very positive development. It allows for therapid growth of trade and movement of capital between different nations. In recent years, many countries have established trade agreements in order to reduce taxes and tariffs on goods entering and leaving their borders. There is a lot of incentive for richer countries to integrate with developing nations in order to utilise their industrial capacity. China is the perfect example of this. In the last few decades, China's economy has grown exponentially due to exposure to the international market. Research has shown that this is particularly profitable for developing nations.

There are some drawbacks to economic globalisation. Many large corporations have been criticized for exploiting cheap labour. Although developing nations benefit greatly from this practice, local economies suffer since jobs are being outsourced to other countries. This leads to economic stagnation for countries such as Great Britain and the United States. In some situations, big companies will even take advantage of the lack of laws and regulations in developing nations. This often leads to unethical working practices and standards such as child labour in Malaysian sweatshops.

title: Animal Protection Programs
postContent:
Preventing species from extinction. Discuss

Supporting ideas

Due to the widespread destruction of natural habitats, more animals are now in danger of becoming extinct than ever before. Humanity has only just recently developed a sense of responsibility for nature. Animal protection programs are the direct result of this newfound responsibility and they are primarily conducted by our zoos and wildlife reserves.

Some people do not believe that we have any duty to preserve biodiversity. Darwin's laws of evolution and his principle of "survival of the fittest" state that extinction is the natural result of being unable to adapt. However, human activity in the past two centuries have accelerated the change of global conditions far beyond the natural state. As such, it is important to consider the repercussions of our artificially created conditions and how extinctions can affect our own survival.Humans are very dependent on nature in terms of food, technology and even the air we breathe. If nature loses it balance, the results could trigger a catastrophic chain reaction which wipes out a whole ecosystem. Currently, we consume animals as part of our dietary intake, we use them do develop new medicines and treatments and we are inspired by them when it comes to developing technology. Most of our new tech comes from a process called biomimicry where we borrow the features of natural organisms. Therefore, the loss of a species is a loss for all of humanity.

Zoos and wildlife reserves serve a dual purpose when it comes to preservation: They receive public funding to run preservation and breeding projects; they also function as an educational exhibition to raise awareness for animal protection. There are countless examples of fantastic preservation programs, from pandas in China to polar bears at the south pole. These usually involve a huge amount of effort to construct an artificial environment that simulates their natural habitat where they can be carefully cared for and monitored.

In terms of education, most zoos will run educational tours for local public schools. The aim of these programs is to teach children an appreciation for wildlife so that they will grow up with a healthy respect for animals. While this is certainly an excellent goal, many critics pointto the fact that the animals exhibited in zoos are being held in captivity and are often trained to do entertaining "tricks". This means that kids are being given a very inaccurate impression of what animals are like and how they should be treated. It questions whether domesticating animals is the same as showing them respect. In spite of this, animals at zoos are generally well cared-for and they represent a healthy shift in our environmental consciousness.

title: The pressing problem
answer:
Supporting ideas
Global problems: 
1. Environmental problems such as climate change and natural disasters pose a great threat to the earth.
2. Air pollution is one of the main causes of this alarming trend. To be more specific, a large amount of gas emissions from factories and motor vehicles has led to global warming, which resulted in a rising sea level.
3. Another factor is overpopulation. Consequently, people produce more wastes and pollutants, which are harmful to the soils, plants, rivers and oceans.

Solutions: 
1. Humans are responsible for preventing damages caused by various activities.
2. Governments can adopt several strategies by imposing a tax on car users and manufacturers, improving public transport system and educating citizens about birth control in developing countries.
3. Organizations should invest in clean, renewable energy sources, and use less chemical materials on products. Finally, individuals should not only arise nature protection awareness, but also implement actions such as walking or taking a bus or train instead of driving.

title: Children’s acts
answer:
Supporting ideas
Agree: 1. Parents have a duty of supervision of their children. To be more specific, it is parent's responsibilities to teach social behaviour to their children and to discipline them because children do not have the sense of good values. For example, parents should teach children not to take anything that does not belong to them.
2. It is often said that parents are their kids' first teachers. What parents teach is actually done by the children when they are exposed to the social environment. The research shows that a child who was born in an abusive environment is more likely to grow up with the propensity for violence.

Disagree: 
1. The children themselves, rather than their parents, should be more responsible for what they have done. Most of us grow up learning that if things get tough, mom and dad will find a way to bail you out, taking all the pressure off ourselves. This can be truly dangerous, and as a result that children can easily become over dependent.
2. Whether parents should pay for their children's behaviour depends on the age of their children. If children can fully understand the consequence of their actions, it should be considered as their own decisions and they should be totally responsible for that.

title: Placing advertisements in schools
question: Some people think placing advertisements in schools is a great resource for public schools that need additionally funding,but others think it exploits children by treating them as a captive audience for corporate sponsors. Choose which position you most agree with and discuss why you choose that position. Support your point of view with details from your own experiences,observations or reading.

title: Motivation and practice in learning
question: With enough amounts of motivation and practice,people can learn anything that the experts teach in the classroom. Agree or not.

title: The value of traveling is overrated
answer:
Supporting ideas:
Necessary:
1.Travelling can broaden people's horizon to understand the world.
2.There is a survey from SYTA showing that comparing with learning from physical form, such as books and computer, traveling is an efficient way to learn. Moreover, people who love to travel have a strong desire to go to the university.
3.Travelling will make you interested in learning and want to learn new knowledge actively, and will help you determine your future direction.
4.Some people tend to be very shy. However, when they travel outside, they have to be social. In this way, their communication skills are improved.

Not necessary
1.Travelling is not the required factor for students who want to attain a higher education, since lots of excellent experts study in the local area.
2.Apart from knowing the world through traveling, students should pay more attention to develop their learning capability to achieve a good academic grade.
question: It is often argued that the value of traveling is overrated, and that there are many brilliant scholars who study locally. Is travel really necessary to attain a higher education?

title: Formal written assessments
answer: Supporting ideasAgree:1. Traditional written examinations enable teachers to assess the extent of students' knowledge.2. Students are forced to demonstrate what they learn from lessons and courses.3. It is easy for teachers to monitor plagiarism and cheating in a classroom with all students.Disagree:1. Some topics cannot be tested by paper, so children may only pay attention to the topics that will be examined.2.These examinations do not train students to think independently, but only cramming.3.It cannot assess one's capacity in a comprehensive way.
question: Whether formal written examination can be a valid method to assess students learning. To what extent do you agree or disagree?

title: The space travel
answer:
Agree: 
1. In the process of overcoming the difficulties and challenges of the space travel, human beings achieved the rapid development of space science and technology.
2. People can explore the possibility of colonizing other planets during the space travel.
3. Space tourism can raise money for further space research.

Disagree: 
1.The space travel may lead to the environmental problems, by emitting large amounts of carbon dioxide
2.The space travel could contribute to global warming.
3.The space travel will cause fossil fuel consumption and air pollution.
4.Safety and health issues need to be considered, and there are some accidents happened in the history of the space travel.
5.The space tourism project is expensive and needs strong technical support, but some technical problems have not been solved yet.
question: The space travel is fantastic these days,but there are many environmental problems in our planet. Should we resolve the problems or travel space and spend a lot of money?

title: One car or alternative vehicle
postContent: Some people suggest that each family should only have one car and encourage alternative vehicle. Do you agree?

title: Preventing species from extinction
postContent: Prevent species from extinction. Discuss

title: The environmental problems
question: The environment we are living in is in danger due to various problems. What are the underlying causes? Who do you think should be responsible to solve these issues – governments,organizations or individuals? What measures should we adopt?

title: Studying climate change
answer:
Climate change continuously increases the worldwide temperatures. The raised temperature directly impacts on a range of fields and leads to other catastrophic problems, such as increased sea-levels, extreme weather, deforestation and long drought period.

People have to tackle these problems which raised from climate change, for example, Australian where fires last year destroyed millions of hectares. During that period, although the fires far away from the cities, people living along the east coast are all suffered from terrible smoke.

Climate change undoubtedly increase the sea-levels. And we all know that raised sea-levels would claim many lives around the world. According to the scientists, Sea-level rise could force three times as many people in the US from their homes by the end of this century. Moreover, 70% of people who live near-shore have to move their homes to the inner land.
question: You need to study climate change. Which aspect of climate change will you choose and why? Use examples.
